text: Teddy Frye was such a delight to work with. Very nice and pleasant experience. He got me in the car I wanted. I came in with a smile and left with an even bigger one! Thank you Teddy!! I would recommend River game Kia and Teddy to everyone.

name: Darren Baugh
text: I stopped in today to take a look at a pre-owned Kia Soul that my son was interested in.  The car was so clean and nice and the price was so good that I couldn't pass it up.  Mr. Harvey was very polite and friendly and a pleasure to work with and took great care of me.  I would definitely recommend you go see him if you need a car.

name: Shelby W
text: After my Nissan Cube's transmission went out, I was out of options and needed something quick. I knew Drivetime would be far too expensive for what you get. I first tried Jim Burke who only wanted to offer $500 for my car. So I went to Riverchase Kia, they gave me $5000 trade in towards a new 2017 Kia Forte. They helped me every step of the way and I was driving off the lot in this wonderful car. At 23, I never thought I'd have a brand new car. Leo Henry was a wonderful salesman who didn't try to force me into something too expensive just to make a good sale. He gave me what I wanted. Very quick process, friendly employees, and a wonderful salesman. I don't have good credit and they gave me advice on how to help that without scolding me on it. I felt completely comfortable here.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your review with us, Shelby! We appreciate your kind words and are glad you enjoyed your experience at our dealership. Please let us know if there is anything else our team here at Riverchase Kia can do to help. Thanks again!

name: Mandy O.
text:
One is simply to high of a rating for the Service Department. In that respect, I wish ratings could be separated for sales and service as I have never purchased there.
The Service Manager is horrible to deal with. He doesn't return calls, he indicates his technicians are incompetent and only he knows how to do things. The service advisor that checked me out -not my SA - told me I was being charged for services never done in the past, except for the fact that my last service was there and the prior one was where I bought the car last year. After more than a month of waiting and being told the SM wasn't in/available during afternoons, etc I called and actually talked to the SM. He ask me to bring it by so he could check. Nothing the techs and advisors talked about with the SM were ever done by the SM. He doesn't care. I honestly feel bad for anyone that works for someone that has to constantly put their employees down since he is the only one that would know how to do anything.
When I stopped by he was very rude and even told me in front of a group of people while hanging onto my car door I wouldn't be happy without getting something free...I told him I would be happy with an actual call back. My car is under warranty, and the SA had even told me she would reach out to a used or new car sales manager for assistance since she wasn't able to get a response (they have no control over service but she was trying). Rating mid level or lower doesn't matter on service reviews, no inquiry then either. After I left, I called the dealership to speak to the GM. I had to leave a message which to this day hasn't been returned.
The advisors were not the same ones from my previous visit. Maybe high turnover? Either way, consider another dealership for service. The previous advisors and manager were easy to deal with, albeit I have no idea on the work part not being done as mentioned by new SA. I took my car by the dealership near my parents the same day I saw the SM and they were flabbergasted - that dealership indicated that issues would have came up amd be evident if it hadn't been serviced correctly.

name: Paul Graves
text: We had an excellent experience buying our Forte 5 from Leo Henry and the staff at Riverchase Kia.  From the initial contact through the final handover of the keys (we had only the vaguest idea of what we were looking for in a new car), the experience was easy! The staff was friendly, knowledgeable (Leo's knowledge of the car models was almost encyclopedic!), and did everything they could to help us find a car we liked, liked to drive, and fit what we were looking for.  Highest possible recommendation - if you are in the market for a car - check them out (we drove 60 miles to see them and are glad that we did).

resp.text: Thank you for your amazing review, Paul! Leo and the whole team here at Riverchase were more than happy to help you find the perfect car to fit all your needs! We appreciate your recommendation, and are glad that you had such an excellent car buying experience. Thank you for choosing Riverchase Kia and we hope to work with you on all your future car needs! Enjoy your new Forte5!

name: LynnTV
text: Worst car experience I have ever had. Bought a part  2 weeks ago, and didn't hear anything from them if the part had come in or not. I called them and they had the part, and schedule me to come in Monday. While I'm there, I'm told the person that was suppose to call me was fired. After waiting an hour, they then tell me that the part they order was wrong. Mad, I talk to the service manager and he tells me that the warehouse sent the wrong part. Later that night, I decided to look up the part number on the Kia website, and they order the wrong part and that they upsold it  me the part. Its 135 on the website, but they sold it to me for 195.  I called today to get an appointment set up to finally get the correct part on, and I have to wait another week. So far it has been a month to get this taken care of. If I didn't have to go here, I wouldn't have gone here at all.

name: LeAnn Rivera
text: I've bought many cars from other dealerships and have had some terrible experiences, but this one was AWESOME! Teddy didn't "sell" me a car, I bought one from him! He gave excellent customer service and worked hard to get me exactly what would make me happy!! Thank you so much!

text: In my opinion I found out a sales advertisement sent to me was a con job after going down there to check it out and claim my prize.Also when I pointed it out the salesman snatched my mailer they sent me out of my hand then told me it was not mine and he could do it cause they sent it.I informed him that it was my mail once I had recieved it in the mail and that what he did was stealing my mail and a felony and to return it immediately.At that point he handed it off to another salesman who knew what he did was wrong and wanted nothing to do with it (in my opinion) and handed it back to me immediately.I left and went down to the Pelham police department and reported it and they agreed to send a officer down there to warn them that stealing my mail was wrong and not to do it again.I would not trust them at all!

text: I didn't like it,they tried to rip me off,and my wife,I didn't like it at all, I thought that good salesmanship was suppose to be helpful in you being satisfied with the offer that they give you, but unfortunately this was not the case.

text: Bought 2 cars today, but was expecting only to look.  Couldn't pass up the deal they gave me.  TEDDY FRYE has to be my all time favorite salesman. He worked very hard at finding what my daughter and I wanted at the price we had in mind....and made it happen.  My very first KIA dealership visit and purchase. Thanks for choosing Riverchase Kia and we hope you'll be back for another fantastic experience in the future! Congrats on your first Kia!

text: I don't usually take time to write reviews but after receiving exceptional customer service from Teddy Frye at Riverchase Kia I just had to share my story.   I had been looking all over the Birmingham area for an affordable car given my low credit score and never having owned a vehicle.  Teddy was extremely knowledgeable and understanding and was able to help me get my very first car.  It was a dream come true and has helped me in so many areas of my life. name: Danielle Bright
text: We got a car a few weeks ago. Teddy was our salesman and he was great to work with! He didn't try to force us into anything and tried his best to get us were we needed to be! Ask for Teddy you won't regret it!!!! 😊

resp.text: Thank you! We appreciate your review and are glad we could make your purchasing process an easy and enjoyable one.

name: Anthony Cornelius
text: Great fast service. Wasn't stuck here all day buying a car.

name: Keith Colwell
text: All of the staff are friendly and willing to do whatever they can to help you get into the best situation as they can.

name: David Jenkins
text: Was really happy with the deal they gave us a couple years ago on my wife's car. Only have it serviced in the facility. The guy in there Jarrell is really great to work with.

name: Andrew Durhan
text: If I could give them negative stars I would.  I bought a used car, no warranty, from them on Monday March 4th.  They assured me it was in good shape and the sales man, Myron, even said he was going to buy it for his daughter but she needed a little larger car.  Well, I bought the car, paid cash, and it died THAT evening!!! They were nice and took the car back since it was less than 24 hours, but they are a dealer with a service department and they probably knew it had engine problems.  They said they would return my money via a mailed check within 7-10 days.  Well....it is day 11 and still no check and I need to go buy a car.  DO NOT USE THESES PEOPLE!!! They live up to their title of "Used Car Salesmen"!!!

name: notthebeesxoxo
text: Service department is TRASH. They will try to take you for every penny you have. I went in for a simple oil change and was then told I needed new front rotors and brakes pads. Okay, I understand that they do need to be replaced, no issues with that. My issue was with them telling me it would cost close to FIVE HUNDRED DOLLARS. Just for the front. I said hell no, left and went to the AutoZone on the other side of the parking lot and bought rotors and brakes pads for the front AND back for $220. I then found a cheaper mechanic who only charged $100 to replace my current ones with the new ones I had just bought. So I paid $320 or so for front and back rotors and brakes pads when Riverchase Kia tried to charge me $500 for just front. I used to go there every single oil change because they were nice, (sometimes) fast and efficient. I haven't been back yet and I will never go back. It's disgusting how much they try to screw people out of money. $1,000+ to have front and back rotors and brakes pads replaced... Out of their MINDS!!!! My mechanic told me they were screwing me over and that they are known for doing that. Never again. 👎

name: Sarah Buchmann
text: So I made an appointment on Monday for Wednesday service. I called on Monday to ask about some quotes for services, was put through to a voicemail and left one but never heard back. I called again on Tuesday to be told that they couldn’t quote me prices until I got there and they had inspected my car. Wednesday morning I dropped my car off at 8:15 for an oil change, to have a tire patched and to have my axle looked at. The service individual who checked me in said it would take a couple of hours. I left to run some errands. While I was out, I called back to tell them not to run diagnostics on my axle since I was quite sure I knew the issue and didn’t want to pay $115 for them to check it out. The person I spoke with on the phone said they would notify the service department. At 11:45 I go back to see if my car was close to being done as I had called twice with no answer. When I got there the service person comes out to tell me they had just run diagnostics. I told him they should not have done that as I called and told them not to. He said he was never notified and gave me attitude for not knowing the name of who I spoke to as it “went through a call center.” He then comes back after I asked if my car was done and said that the oil change and tire patch for the leak had not been done. When I asked why it had not been done after three hours and me having had an appointment he wasn’t able to give me an answer. I left, taking my vehicle with me and no services done. When I signed papers while leaving I noticed a note at the top that said “pick up time 6pm.” However, I was never told this at the beginning. Beyond frustrated with these people and will not go back ever.

name: Jaime Foley
text: Had a wonderful time working with Rick Henry at this dealership. He went above and beyond to earn our business, and we will be back to see him for our next purchase. Friendly and curteous customer service!

name: Bianca Norris
text: Had an amazing experience here at Riverchase Kia! The staff there was awesome and helped me to pick out the car of my dreams! I love my 2018 Optima SXL!!!

name: Freestyle Reese22
text: I came in on a Saturday to get oil change and tire rotation and balance. Wednesday as I’m driving home, oil light comes on and smoke from under the hood. I made it home and found oil leaking from under the car. I call Wednesday to make an appointment to bring my car in on Thursday to be fixed. Thursday I arrive around 8:20 that morning and drop the car off so I could get to work that I was already late for. I called them around 1-2pm the evening to check status of my car. Season stated they hadn’t gotten to it yet and it was being sent somewhere else were it would be checked out in more detail. So they put me in a rental covered by them. They called Friday afternoon and said my car was ready and I asked why was it leaking oil and they said the plug was stripped and that it wasn’t a Kia plug. If the technician knew the plug was stripped why did he put it back on there, regardless of if it was a Kia plug or not. Also, Wednesday when I came to drop the car off, I told them that I would like to get the recalls fixed on it since I already had to drop the car off. I asked the person checking me in did he need the recall papers that I had gotten sent in the mail and he said he could look it up by the VIN. Saturday morning I come in to pick up my car and ask them for diagnostic report on what was done on the car & they tell me about the plug and I asked were the recalls fixed and they said it wasn’t any notes about a recall needing to be fixed. The guy that checked me in Wednesday stated he didn’t remember me saying anything about a recall and he was sorry, Season said they would get it in to be fixed because of the situation but they normally do not do recalls on saturdays. I already knew that because of the previous Saturday I came in for the oil change and asked about the recall. So I guess the pros would be that she did say they would fix the recalls but cons is that I still have to sit and wait on my car on something that they were supposed to had already done. I also spoke with Tim the supervisor about the issues that I was having. I am stuck in a hard place because Riverchase Kia is the only Kia dealership in Birmingham, and I don’t want just any person working on my car and thought I was doing the right thing by bringing to their service center. So I gave them two stars, one for getting the recalls fixed on a Saturday and the other for putting me in a rental while they were getting my vehicle fixed.

name: David and Stacey Williams
text: Great experience and excellent service!! Lamar Black helped us with the purchase of our 2nd Kia and we couldn't have asked for better customer service. We'll definitely be back!

name: Michael Harkless
text: The customer service was excellent. I spoke with J over the phone a few days prior because I was having a difficult time getting there due to my busy work schedule. J was professional, courteous, and polite from beginning to end. Not only did Riverchase Kia take care of the issues with my car but they did so with empathy and respect. Thanks Riverchase Kia.

name: Rona Scott
text: As always, wonderful place to buy a car.  This is our 3rd Kia.  This make of auto is sooooo underrated.  I'm not sure we will ever drive anything else.  Lamar, our sales person, was awesome.  So nice.  I know that he's there to do a job and sell cars but he made us feel like we'd been friends for years.  Riverchase Kia is the best of the best. Our salesperson was super. Our whole experience was and is perfect. Go get a Kia! You'll be glad you did!!

resp.text: Thanks, Rona! We think you are a wonderful customer and are so happy that you love Kia cars because we do, too! Lamar is an awesome salesman and we are thrilled that you enjoyed working with him during your recent visit. We truly appreciate your business and are looking forward to the next opportunity we have to provide you with another incredible experience! Safe travels in your new Kia!

name: Jon Ward
text: Found passenger side CV axle leaking grease during a oil change on my vehicle (2018 Sorento). Vehicle was under warranty and they replaced the boot and clamp on the passenger side. Took the vehicle home and found the vehicle pulling to the right. Returned and they quickly performed an alignment and corrected the issue. Looking at the alignment specs it was a very minor adjustment, probably would have never noticed it honestly if I was not paying close attention after having the CV axle boot replaced. Either way they quickly handled the issue and repaired it to my satisfaction. Again looking back at the specs it was a very minor adjustment and several garages would have brushed it off and said it was in your head, I respect a service department that will take the time and correct minor alignment specs.

name: Kimberly Young
text: A super place to buy your next vehicle. Very friendly staff, clean waiting area and extremely clean service department. They Wii go out of their way to get you the vehicle you want. Financing us a breeze with KIA!

name: Amber Wilson
text: Steven Willard is the best salesman ever! I highly recommend him! He went above and beyond what he had to to get me into a vehicle.  😃

name: jeannette barnes
text: Just bought my 2017 Kia Forte Saturday, Myron D was a great guy, he helped me in every way possible. I will forever buy from Riverchase Kia.. Thank you Myron.

name: Cryptid Kitty
text: Myron and the entire staff were amazing. Would definitely recommend to friends and family.

name: raymond goldman
text:
on march 19, 2018  we bought a new KIA.

Why did you send my credit application to five (5) different banks? Each one doing a credit check.   you already had my credit score.

Finance manager over charged us on some things, resulting a refund.  WHY???  how much does this guy make?  too much!!!!!

Made purchase in the morning, that afternoon called LIONEL, our salesman, no answer, left word for call back.  as of this date no response????

name: Ginger Taylor
text: My husband and I, both, currently own 2012 Kia cars. My husband’s optima started mimicking known Kia Optima engine issues such as burning through the recommended oil, loosing power going down the road and we had it towed there for a second opinion. They claimed there is nothing wrong with the car and basically inferred that we were lying about any issues. We were just at their dealership looking to upgrade my car to the new Telluride but after this experience I would not give my money to this location if they had the last Telluride in America. I would not recommend the dealership or the service center ever after this experience. Once we left the dealership his car broke down within 10 miles..we had it towed to Trussville Kia and the motor was replaced free of charge since it’s under the extended  warranty. This was after we were charged over $100 to be told nothing was wrong...

name: Morretta Paige
text: I wasn't pleased with this place..i spoke on the phone with Mr Massey called ahead to make sure he would be there and he still wasn't there...then passed on to a man named Leo..when he found out my particular situation he didn't seem interested at all to work with me...I  explained to Mr Massey  that I was upside down in a car and everything else that was making it hard for me to get a car however he assured me to drive to the dealership  and he would get me into  a car..said he was the manager..yes he is a manager of the internet... Bottom line customer service was horrible.. I  felt judged because of my past and looked down on because of my present..but they don't know my future..Kia just be careful and mindful of customer service regardless of if I have 700 credit score or 300...

text: My mother purchased a vehicle from Lamar Black.  He made her very happy.  She bragged about how nice he was to her and really took care of her.

text: There are really not enough words to say what a horrible experience I had with this dealership. Complete scam artists. I asked why there were 2 sticker prices on the car. I was told I would get the lower price and to ignore the other price just like “a customer inside was doing.” Then the vehicle was marked up the higher price while trying to trick me into thinking I’m getting $3k for my trade in. Actually, I would get NOTHING since they marked the vehicle up. They also refused my pre-approval from my credit union and wanted to run my credit yet again. Why run again when I was already approved? The salesman Kyle was nice, but the finance team was completely ridiculous. I walked out and I’m so very pleased with my new vehicle which is NOT a Kia. Thanks for treating me like garbage though. Really made me day!

Had a great time working with Teddy Frye great sales man he made getting the Kia Soul so much painless he answered all my questions that I had about  buying a used car I would recommend this dealer and sales person to anyone buying a new or used car.

Thank you Teddy Frye

name: Erica Landreth
text: I had a great experience with Riverchase Kia when I purchased my first Kia back in 2012, but that was not the case when I went to trade it in last month. It has been a little over a month and I found out  a couple of weeks ago that Riverchase Kia never paid off my old car like they were supposed to do, and in fact, I nor they have any idea who my lender is. I am going to take my new car back in and get my old car back because the contract I signed is bogus on multiple accounts. I will never do business here again!!!!

resp.text: Ms. Landreth, we were not able to find your information, or history of a purchase, in our customer database. However, we did have a male customer who purchased a vehicle in 2012, then tried to trade it in last month. We had issues with getting him financed due to private matters that we don't feel comfortable with sharing on a public platform, as it involves sharing personal information regarding the customer's employment. At RiverChase Kia it is our goal that every customer leave our dealership satisfied with their experience, so we would like to discuss this matter in further detail if the aforementioned customer experience is indeed what you are referring to. Please contact us at your convenience at (877) 608-1967. Thank you.

name: Don Harbor
text:
My daughter decided that I could no longer afford the constant, expensive repair bills on my old car. And that a new car with a great warranty was my solution. I was skeptical but played along.
She discovered that Hyundai and Kia had the best warranties so we narrowed our search to the Hyundai Accent and the Kia Soul. I first drove an Accent and liked it, but the salesman just smiled at me when we mentioned the particulars of my old vehicle for trade. We headed to Riverchase Kia and were greeted in the parking lot by salesman Mr. Harvey. From Mr. Harvey’s handshake forward he made us feel like we were going to leave with a new car at a monthly payment I can afford. And we did! Mr. Harvy offered us a most generous trade-in value for my old car and worked very hard all afternoon to finally match our financial goal. I love my new Kia Soul. It’s the perfect car for me. I can’t imagine a more pleasant car buying experience, thanks to my daughter, Mr. Harvy and the other kind folks at Riverchase Kia.

resp.text: Thank you! We are happy to hear you enjoyed your purchasing experience and we hope you are enjoying your new vehicle. Thank you for sharing your review.

text: Great place to come and get a great deal on purchasing your car.

Overall I would definitely recommend this dealership to anyone. Also, of course I will also tell how great of an experience I had, and once how fantastic Teddy Fyre was to me and my family.

I highly recommend riverchase kia to anyone!! They have great customer service, which is always a plus to me!

name: Jason Foster
text: Dont take your car there to be worked on. We have bought 3 cars from them in the last 3 years. I have a 15 forte that the battery went dead 3 weeks ago, had it replaced. Now it's in there cause the back caliper locked up. A $1300 fix. Now our 16 forte with 35000 miles that I bought from them exactly a year ago battery has gone dead, and it's not covered on any warranty. In less than a month, I will have shelled out over $1500 to them and they could care less about helping us out. They have NO customer service, they dont care about anything but nickel and diming you to death. I bought the car 1 year ago with 16000 miles on it from them. They do not do a good job of keeping their customers wanting to come back....I WILL NEVER BUY ANOTHER KIA FROM RIVERCHASE KIA....AND DEFINITELY NOT TAKE IT TO THEM FOR ANY MORE WORK TO BE DONE ON THEM.

name: Preston Joiner
text: Friendly service with a great selection of new and used vehicles all have been serviced and check out and include extended warrantys they also have a parts center and full service mechanic area

name: Mary Ann Stephens
text: Very, very unhappy with Frank McCauley and his lack of communication with his staff and knowledge of Kia warranties.  Was told car was fixed on Saturday from a check engine light and all that was done was a recall on something in the steering.  Came back on again Tuesday and the same problem was indicated as the Tuesday before.  Brought back in and was told it needed a new battery and should fix the problem.  Was not told car was having another problem.  Light came back on after I replaced my battery.  Yesterday i talked with Frank and he told me his tech noted I was told and didn't have time to stay to have work done.  He was very rude.  Went back in today and girl admitted in front of Frank and me that she did fail to tell me of the other issue.  No apology by him.  Stayed to finally get work done and had waited for about 45 minutes and Frank came out to tell me the adjustment was not covered under warranty....shouldn't he had already known this and told me this yesterday?  Yes I was upset for them dropping the ball 3 times.  Frank did not attempt to make it right.

resp.text: Mary, we are sorry you felt your recent service visit did not meet all your expectations. We strive to provide the best service, including open communication and informative assistance, to our customers and would appreciate the chance to speak with you further to make your experience right. At your convenience, please reach out to Kevin Woody at 205-987-6518 and he will be happy to discuss your concerns. We take customer feedback very seriously and hope to have another opportunity to take care of your needs in any way that we can. Thank you.

name: Page McMonroe
text: Teddy and Myron were great! If you are needing a car and want a Kia come see them!

name: Really J
text: We went here for a specific car they had listed on their website, but lo and behold they didn't have it(lowered to a 3). They tried to push us onto a higher priced car, knowing our budget(lowered to a 2 star). We probably won't go back unless they have a killer offer.

name: katelynn O'Neill
text: We went to Riverchase Kia in Pelham, we looked online and found a car there that we wanted to get, it was $12,900, My dad called and emailed with a person there and they told us they had the car there and we could come look at it so we set up an appointment, drove 45 minutes to get there, they sat us in a cubicle and we waited for 20 minutes and then the salesman came back and said that the car they confirmed to us an hour ago that was there, wasn’t actually there and they had taken to an auction. So we left, and the manager called us to apologize and said his manager would have it back this evening, and for our trouble he would bring the car to us to let us test drive it and everything, so my dad emails with him asking for the numbers and information, and then he calls us and tells us that someone else offered $15,000 for it and asked if we wanted it for that price. We said no. Horrible experience. Ruined my entire day. Thanks.

name: Joseph Bibb
text: Bought a preowned Kia Joey found the perfect vehicle for me and my needs. I will recommend Joey to all my friends and family

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback! Joey is a fantastic member of our team and we are so happy that he could help you find the perfect vehicle. We value your business and look forward to working with you again!

text: Joey Bibb is the salesman to see if you're interested in a Kia. He's listens to the customers' needs and desires, and then locates the car!!

text: Jerel Gary is the best Service Mangager I every meet. He told me and my wife about the service’s and how much everything would cost. But like my wife said in the car I think we found our place to get out KIA service thanks to Jerel. Who’s every the owner make sure you keep him around.

name: Yolanda “MiMi” Mcgee
text: My service needs are met, they get me in and out ask for Ann Claire!

name: Sheila Robinson
text: Never go to get service on your car!!  I took my car in for a recall and ask if my headlight was covered under my warrenty. I have moisture in it nd it is blown.  The girl was Season Stockton and she told me that it wasn't covered.  I have just over 50,000 miles on my car. A friend told me it should be covered months later so I called back and spoke to the manager and since Season did not document me asking about headlight and my car has 60,000 miles on it they will not replace it.  So i have to come up with hundreds of dollars all because someone did not do there job.....Season Stockton!

name: Casey Garrison
text: My wife and myself began the dreaded search for a good deal on a new car for her.  After trying 3 different places we decided to give Riverchase Kia a shot.  Joey Bibb was our salesman and he went above and beyond our expectations!!  We had a certain car in mind and he didn't try to sell us something different.  Joseph and all of the staff at Riverchase Kia were very patient and informative.  We had to bring our kids (6&2) with us and all of the staff were great at making us feel welcomed!  I would highly recommend calling Joey Bibb at Riverchase Kia if you are in the market for a new car!!!!

resp.text: Thank you! We are happy to hear you enjoyed your purchasing experience and we hope you are enjoying your new vehicle. Thank you for sharing your review.

resp.text: We really appreciate your review and kind words about Joey! He is a fantastic team member who makes every car buying experience great! Thanks for choosing Riverchase Kia and we look forward to working with you again, Shannon!

name: Christopehr Johnson
text: I’m going to be honest with you it has been over 3yrs since I had my vehicle back at Riverchase Kia. I had some bad experiences here in the past. When I came in expecting the worse a gentlemen by the name of Jarrell approach me with this huge smile. I explained to him my visit in the past. And he explained to me that things are better and he’s here and the people who didn’t do me right wasn’t here anymore. I took his word and I had an awesome experience. So guess what Riverchase I’m coming back because of him. You need to make sure that you keep Jarrell around because that what it’s about. Having a ear to here and showing the customer that we are important and we have feelings as well. Who’s every the General Manager is make sure you keep this gentlenmen.

name: Janie Finney
text:
Please read all of this to get a sense of the place:

They get two stars because the sales guy Stan was nice (while we were there) and gave me food when my blood sugar was crashing. He was so sweet (I almost want to put that into satirical marks) while we talked through wait periods. Good family guy who is proud of his kids and was very generous in his compliments to my husband. This was fine. I would have left a 5 star review with just that interaction. He didn't seem to push us into anything particular or expensive because we knew what we wanted and he knew that too. To be honest, my husband knew more about the cars on that lot than most of the salesmen at the store. To be even more honest, we had no intentions of buying a car that day, but we were talked into it. Not a horrible choice, but not my optimum choice at this time. In the end I wanted to make my husband happy and get a hybrid because it is better for the environment and because we commute a lot. I would have waited a year or two before doing this, but that is out the window now. However, all of that isn't the issue. While we were there, everyone was nice. Stayed there for almost 5 hours getting paperwork done and waiting to be approved for a loan. We're young and like to talk, so we didn't mind. We get a fair interest rate, seeing as how my husband just came out of bankruptcy. This is good. We sign all the contracts, my husband haggles about the extra warranty. All of that is good. We hand over the keys to the car we traded in, clean it out and into our new car, etc. All of the contracts are signed, everything is good. We leave HAPPY. Very happy. Extremely proud of our car.

This is when things start to go bad. I get a call a few days later because they lost my husband's pay stub. No problem. He sends an email with a new one. This apparently isn't "clear" enough "for the banks." Alright. So he sends another one, a PDF copy as clear as day. A human mistake happens and he misspelled Stan's email (missed 1 s). A week almost goes by and I haven't gotten any calls, and neither has my husband. We think everything is fine so we forget about it. Not to mention, it is the end of the semester for me, so the only thing I am worried about it getting homework done, studying for exams, and emailing people from my school email. This, however, is where some of the blame falls onto me. I had gotten 3 emails from Stan on the 4th and on the 5th. The email on the 4th was fine. It just wanted a new copy because he couldn't find an attachment (because of the mess up earlier as my husband was at work and had just made a human error). The third and last email is where I am taking away 3 stars and am very upset about. It is added into this review, untouched outside of cutting away unnecessary bits of the screenshot of my computer screen. Seeing as how the place is a business, I find no issue with giving away the details in this email. In my opinion, I find the tone of the email to be very unprofessional, threatening, and rude. He could have called (in my call logs I received no calls from him and neither did my husband). Calling would have resolved the issue immediately because any decent person would have realized the mistake and apologized and immediately resent the email correctly with the attachment. Yet, it is okay to threaten to take away a car. And I get it. The bank is putting on pressure to get the pay stub or else they will back out and that is bad for the dealership. However, WE weren't the ones who lost the original pay stub in the first place. WE weren't contacted in a more timely manner about it via phone call. Instead, my junk email just so happened to get checked by my husband yesterday while he was handling other business on the phone and he sees all of the emails. He resends what needs to be resent, and now we wait to see if any other "problems" will arise. Will our signatures be unclear next and somehow void our contract? Will they try to repossess our car because of any other errors on their behalf? Only time will tell.

name: David Wright
text: NOT JUST A SALESMAN, BUT A REAL NICE GUY, I TRADED MY WIFE'S CAR IN AND SHE LEFT HER DIAMOND RING IN THE DASH OF THE CAR.  THE SALESMAN CALLED ME AND SAID HE FOUND IT AND HOLD IT.  HIS HONESTY SHOULD BE REWARDED, SOMETIMES IT IS NOT ABOUT THE PRICE.  IF YOU WANT A NICE HONEST SALESMAN AT RIVERCHASE KIA ASK FOR WILL HARBIN.

name: robert franklin
text: Naji Rucker was awesome. Very knowledgeable and friendly. Would highly recommend a visit to Riverchase Kia for your next car purchase.

name: Janice Tate
text: Teddy Frye was a  excellent salesman, he took the time to make sure I was happy with everything, returned calls immediately and went way above and beyond. I have purchased 5 Kia total for my family and couldn't be happier, he was the best salesmen go see Teddy!

resp.text: We are glad you felt well taken care of at our dealership and that we could meet your expectations. It is great to hear you enjoyed your experience and we appreciate your feedback.

name: Steven Smith
text: Unethical and predatory- pressured sales. Bought an expensive model which then had a recall on the engine! Dealership tried three times during the 2 weeks of replacing the engine to sell us a new Kia. Once completed, without any communication of progress, we were told to claim the car now or pay for part of the rental! When we turned in the rental and picked up the Kia, they tried to charge us $80 for changing the oil- after they replaced the engine!! I would never recommend this dealership or their service department.

name: Sarene Hampton
text: Took my son for repair work on his car. Terrible customer service. They delayed calling him about the problem saying all calls go thru a call center which is not true. I personally witnessed direct calls while I was there. They were rude and led him to believe it would be covered under his extended warranty and it wasn't. Bogus charge for " diagnostic" services when they already knew what the vehicle was coming in for- a scheduled service. Tied his car up all day. We chose another repair shop.

name: Marie Howard
text: They lie. Was approved by 3 banks. But not by in-house bank. Kept us hopefully waiting for apx 3 weeks. Went to drive time and drove my new car home that day.

name: MISTER J
text:
Great,timely, service rep was knowledgeable ,friendly atmosphere
👍👍👍👍👍

name: Kyndell Pullum
text: Riverchase Kia gave great service. All the people I encountered were nice and they got me a great deal I LOVE my new 2018 Sorento SXL!!!

name: Alan Rohm
text: Great experience. I recommend everybody to buy a car at Riverchase Kia.

name: Lisa Boroughs
text: See Clarence he is a very good salesman and works well with you.

name: Charlene Townsend
text: They advertise one thing but it's totally the opposite.  Go to Tony Serra Nissan in Cullman. You'll definitely have a better chance!!

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your feedback, Charlene. We're sorry to learn that you feel you were misled by our advertisement. Our top priority is delivering 100% satisfaction and we will use your comments to help improve our efforts. Please contact Kevin Woody at 205-987-6518 and he will be happy to speak with you to address any concerns you may have.

name: Lars Hitchcoc
text: Today, I easily made an appointment to bring my Kia in to have the airbag light repair that I received an extended warranty on last month. After waiting an hour and a half (when I was told the repair would take an hour) a girl came in and told me that the warranty was only valid for cars that had under 120,000 miles. My car has 122,000. I called Kia customer service and was told that any mileage was accepted for their extended warranties and the only limitation was if my car hadn't been serviced in 15 years. Well it's a 2012 so I don't think that was the case. I also contacted Serra Kia in Birmingham and was told the same thing and that they would be happy to do the repair and have me as a customer. Thank your staff for me for wasting my time and not even doing the repair when there was no reason for them to not do it. I'll happily drive the extra distance to Birmingham to have decent service and can guarantee I won't buy another car from Riverchase Kia again.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing about your experience, Lars. We are disappointed to learn that your experience with our service department was not what you expected. Unfortunately, due to the guidelines of the warranty we were not able to perform the repair. We are sorry if this caused you any inconvenience, and we want you to know that we truly appreciate your business. Please give our Service Manager, Frank, a call at (205) 987-6518 and he will be happy to discuss this matter further with you. We hope that you will give us the opportunity in the future to show you how much we value you as a customer.

name: Henrietta Lee
text: Lionel is very professional and knowledgeable. He is fast and gets you out without spending all your time buying a vehicle.

name: Alecia Smith
text: I purchased a 2016 Inferno Red, Kia Soul Sport about 2 month's ago. Having bought a different Soul back in 2014 I knew exactly where to go and the guy to see. River Chase Kia in Pelham, Al and Joseph(Joey)Bibb made both of my buying experiences truly incredible! Joey never pressured me and worked with me to get the price where I needed it to be. I highly recommend River chase Kia and Joey.So much that my parents also bought a soul from him.

resp.text: Thanks for sharing about your experience, Alecia! It is awesome to hear that Joey has provided you such incredible service that you have come back to buy from him again, and even recommended him to others! We really appreciate your business and look forward to working with you again!

name: Jerrod Mitchell
text: My first time at Kia I had to wait for a oil change for 2 hrs. This gentleman by the name of Jay came to me and ask me what was wrong. I said nothing at first. Because I was mad that I had to wait and I had to walk in the rain to go get me something to eat. Pelham police stop and brought me back to the dealership. Jay actually made me feel better reason because his words to me was man don’t do that any more your my customer and I would never make you walk in the rain. I felt pretty good after he came and said that to me it made me feel like I was on a VIP list. Then he paid for my oil change with his card I was shock now thats customer service because I was upset and he made the situation better. Because of jay I’ll be returning back to Riverchase I almost gave a bad review but jay saved that day. THANK’S JAY keep up the great customer service.

name: Mario Heacock
text:
Marshell was great. He explained each step of the buying process, how the payments work, he explained the 3 different warranties that come with all Kia's and even recommended GAP (Guaranteed Auto Protection) Insurance which will pay off the balance of your loan if your vehicle is totaled and your car insurance company doesn't pay the full value of the car.
This is the best experience that I have ever had purchasing a car, bar none.
All of the employees at Riverchase Kia were genuinely interested in making sure that I understood each step of the buying process and they worked very hard to get the best deal possible on the vehicle that I bought.

resp.text: We are glad you felt well taken care of at our dealership and that we could meet your expectations. It is great to hear you enjoyed your experience and we appreciate your feedback.

name: The Many McKinneys
text: This is our 2nd purchase and we love these guys. Ask for Lamar he was great.

name: Trina Brown
text: I purchased a 2018 Optima S & my experience was awesome.

name: Torie Taylor
text: Purchased our 2018 Kia Optima on March 28, 2018 and have had nothing but headaches from this dealership ever since. First they messed up our income paperwork and hounded by husband and I while at work about needing us to come sign more paperwork after they fixed it. We live an 1 and 1/2 hours away from this dealer but we came here because of commercials and advertising, so getting time off work to make the trip isn't easy but did it. Anyways we sign all the paperwork over again and return home. Go 2 days later to register my new vehicle and the tag office informs me that my bill of sale from river chase Kia has March 28,2017 on it. So my husband and I start calling the dealership and leaving voicemails and messages with the receptionist trying to talk to anyone about getting this fixed. It's been over 24 hours now and still haven't heard anything from them except my salesman who called to tell me he didn't like the review on kia's website I left. Will update later to see if they make this right. As of right now would not recommend this dealer to anyone and I'm regretting buying my new car from them. Other than that we LOVE the car!

name: Tristan Williams
text: I got a car! Wow!  Let me setup my story so you can understand my Wow! So I had a car that was worth 9,000 and I owed 17,000. I went to Riverchase Kia b/c my mama advised me too. I pull up like well let's see. I drive around the place looking at the cars. In my mind I am doubtful. I park and get out and began walking through the cars. ( I always look at the smallest car) even though I am bigger than the car. Out comes Teddy Frye he begins to ask if I need assistance I explain my situation. He said I can help. (Again in my mind I'm like yeah Right) We sit there and I give him. License, check stub and he works out the numbers and says my manager is dealing with the bank lets go drive a car. (Again in my head I'm like NOOOOOOOOO because if I don't get approved I am going to be angry.) We drive I am in a white 2016 Kia Optima with 200 miles in it. Did I mention it was hybrid. So I am shifting from ECO to regular loving it. Mr. Frye is telling me all about the features. We get back to the dealership I am in love. So I wait probably five minutes and guess what I GOT APPROVED. NO LONGER DO I HAVE TO FILE BANKRUPTCY TO GET OUT OF LOAN.  I have a car that is worth something to me... Tears began to stream down my face. Today I am an owner of a 2016 KIA OPTIMA HYBRID. THANKS TEDDY FRYE! SO IF YOU NEED A CAR BAD CREDIT, NO CREDIT, GOOD CREDIT, GO TO RIVERCHASE KIA AND ASK FOR TEDDY FRYE....... GO TEDDY GO TEDDY GO TEDDY!!!!!

resp.text: Wow indeed, Tristan! Thank you for sharing your incredible experience! We are delighted that Teddy was able to help you get in the perfect new car for you with no trouble! He truly is an asset to our team and we love to hear how much our customers enjoy working with him, just like you. Thanks for choosing Riverchase Kia, and thank your mama for recommending us! Enjoy your new Optima Hybrid!

text: Great experience!! Great service!! I love my new Kia Sorrento. Go see Jeroskie Finch aka"Rock" at Riverchase Kia.

resp.text: Thank you! We appreciate your review and are glad we could make your purchasing process an easy and enjoyable one.

text: The service center is always great at keeping me posted on the status of my vehicle.

name: D Mattox
text: Went there for my car's first oil change good service very nice people

name: Suzanne Henderson
text: Teddy is great! He was a tremendous help.

name: Michael Smith
text:
One star is only because I had to.
My wife and I have only been to the service department twice. The first time was for an oil  change.  I always check the oil before and after just to make sure they have done it. Well, they didn't do it. It was free so I didn't make a fuss with them there. I took it to Walmart Service the next day and had better results.
Today, we took it there because my wife's car had a recall on it. They told us they were also going to change the oil for free while we wait. While we were in the waiting room, a lady comes to us with a "Hyundai / Kia In Cabin Air Filter". She said this is your In Cabin Air Filter and it needs changed. Well, a year ago I did change that air filter with a Fram In Cabin Air Filter. So immediately I knew she was lying to us. I even checked to make sure when I got home that the Fram Filter was still there and I wasn't going crazy.
Do not do any business with these people. They lie! I'm pretty sure it's not just the service department.

name: Gregg Stuart
text: WOW!! Teddy met and exceeded all of my expectations in buying a new car! I purchased a 2016 Kia Optima from him last week. He listened to my wants and needs and helped me find a vehicle that was exactly what I needed. On top of all of this I got the car home on Saturday and had to bring it back on Monday morning because of an issue with the sensor on the passenger seat and the seat belt warning, there was also a scratch left by the machine that drilled the holes for the license plate. I expected to be told that I would need to leave the car for a few days (since I had already purchased and why would they need to WOW me at this point right?) But Teddy took one look at the scratch got the dealership manager and the service manager involved, walked back into the waiting area and said, "We're going to give you a different new car instead." Wow!!

resp.text: We are thrilled that you had such an amazing experience working with us here at Riverchase Kia, Gregg! Teddy and our team want to make every customer as happy as they made you so they strive to provide the best customer service possible before, during, and after the sale. It is always fantastic to hear about the "wow" moments so we really appreciate you sharing your experience. Please come back and see us for any of your future car needs!

name: Lesha Roberts

name: Joshua Vanleemput
text:
Turning a Rough Situation Around

Alright were to start. Let me provide you a little setup for my situation that this amazing dealership managed to turn around for me. End of 2014 my old Saturn (yes, the car dealer that went under) with its cracked suspension was traded into a dealership that I thought was reputable. Well put you in a new car they said, don't worry about your credit they said, I end up in the most manual of manuals; roll down windows and all Versa Note. Alright, I can turn this around, I tell myself, they said come back in a year and well get you in something nicer. Year rolls by, go back, "Nope your credit isn't good enough, you got money to put down? Nope, then cant help you, try again next year." Alright, so I continue with this car that I am not happy with, upgrade jobs, still upside down in this car years later. Now its December 2017, still upside down in a car I am not happy with. I hear a jingle on my radio, you all know the one, "We wanna see yea at Riverchase Kia." My wife and I talk and decide lets take a chance, what have we got to lose, if we don't like it we can always walk away. I do my research, and go in with an open mind, telling myself I want one of two vehicles. Optima or Forte. I park at the dealership and out walks one of the best, brightest, and positive salespersons I have ever met. Mr. Lionel T. Lee. I had time to stand and stretch on this cold winter day when he greeted, us. I was not set to meet anyone in particular but I am so glad I met this man. He took us to his desk and talked to us a few minutes about our situation and our plans, asked what I wanted and within 15 minutes he came back. He broke down my station for me but did not send me away.

I am a negative person here folks, of course I was thinking everything had gone to hell and I was just wasting mine and his time, but Mr. Lionel was positive, he said, "I cannot get you an optima, but I am going to get you in a new car. Trust me. I have the perfect one in mind too. How do you feel about a forte." My mind went everywhere but I tried to play the shrewd buyer, I said sure I would be happy to consider if the price is right. And off he went again, another fifteen minutes and back he was to grab his scarf, "Oh you guys are in for a treat, wait here!" Five minutes later I was asked to walk outside and man was I blown away! The Forte was beautiful, I mean pearl white, leather, backup camera, you name it it was in there. I was speechless, he asked what I thought, take a seat, get a feel for it because man this is going to be your car. I know it. I sat in it and never wanted to leave, going from a manual base to this luxury model, you know I almost drooled a little. He asked, "What do you think, anything you want to change on it?" The only thing I could think, "Got it in Grey or Silver!" He just grinned and said, "Yeah, I sure do. Wait here." Exact same model, color I want, hasn't even been an hour and I am test driving the car I could not be happier with! Then the standard numbers talk goes by, no one likes this part but I will state for full disclosure that I was in the negative over 6k on my old car, I was expecting that I was going to have it a little rough but you know it was not nearly as bad as I thought. The discounts were amazing, in fact I walked away an hour later one of the most satisfied kia customers, keys and paperwork in hand and taking a picture in front of my new vehicle. Thank you so much Mr. Lionel for putting up with all my negativity and fighting for me to get me in this new vehicle. Hell I sat in it all day yesterday just playing with all the new toys and features, you are an amazing salesperson and even more so just an amazing person to help someone like me. Thank you again! We will be seeing you again next year to get her out of that jeep!

name: Derek Alldredge
text: Had a great experience at River Chase kia! Clarence Rasberry helped me get into a brand new kia soul! Go see them and let them hook you up!

name: Wes Day
text:
I had several problems with Kia Riverchase yesterday.  My car died during the ice storm, and I HAD to buy a car.  Here are the problems I observed:

1. 12 salesmen standing out front, half of them smoking cigarettes... certainly not illegal, but it just automatically makes any business look really bad fast.  Plus, they obviously overhired, maybe to motivate car sales by putting more hungry vultures on the lot.

2. I dealt first with a guy named Adam.  He was nice enough... the sales manager obviously sensed my hesitation, so he swooped in and began his "Pushy sales guy" mode.  At one point when I started to get up and leave because I felt uncomfortable, he told me I promised him I would buy a car from him if the numbers were right for a used model.  I wanted a new car.

3. Don't even bother looking at the prices of Kias online -- when you get there, everything is 5 to 6 thousand dollars more.  See, that's when they offer you the $6,000 trade in on any model.  Then, they'll act as if they're such great guys doing you such a favor.  It's ludicrous.

I went directly to another dealership, found a car I liked at a reasonable price, and drove away happy.  Stay away from this place unless you just really want to buy a guaranteed box of crap, ("I've got spare time" -- Tommy Boy)

name: Maxwell W
text: Put in an application to get a new car. We did not end up getting the car but surely get a ton of spam calls and email spam from mortgage company and company trying to lend me money. Not worth it.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your feedback!

name: Jessika Ashlee (Hip and Simple)
text: Bought our soul here in Nov 2014. Felt we got ripped off a little and found out they tried to get lending from so many places for the incorrect amount and causes unnecessary credit inquiries. That was annoying to find out weeks after the fact and that they hid it from us. But the big issue is their service. It is impossible to make an appointment for your "free" oil changes. When you do arrive they push a pkg that's like $65 so you can get a tire rotation and other crap. Then when you pick about charging that much for the "free" oil change they say, they'll take the oil change portion of that off the top like they are doing you a favor. Then they claim you need a new filter or something or other, which they changed at the last oil change 5,000 so I ask how often that's needed and they claim it's needed every 10,000-15,000 not knowing we just had it done the time before. So your free oil change is $75 + when you are done. It's cheaper to go elsewhere to get all the same things done.

resp.text: Ms. Reed, at RiverChase Kia it is our goal that every customer leave our dealership satisfied with their experience. We apologize if you feel as though you did not receive the positive experience we strive for. We would like to discuss this issue in more detail, so please contact us at your earliest convenience at 407-792-3972. Thank you.

name: ashley huntley
text: Awesome experience.. looking forward to driving my new car... #Kia.Forte #Jeroskie Finch

resp.text: It is great to hear you enjoyed your purchasing experience and we appreciate your feedback. Thank you for sharing your review!

name: Akins Josh
text:
My wife had been in rolling DOT hazard for a while.  It was passed time to get her a new ride.  We did a one stop shop.  We knew Riverchase Kia had awesome deals on their new Kias.  However, this was not the market we were looking for purchase from.  We were after a slightly used but still certifiable new to us SUV.  Teddy met with us.  He asked what we were looking for in a purchase today, and said that he would do his best to keep us from going anywhere else.  Teddy did just that.  We were up front with him on the financials that we had and the monthly payment we need to stay around.  My wife was looking for something older with many more miles, but I wanted to have something that had warranty and miles to a minimum.  Teddy brought us a single option, The Right Option.  A very low mileage Sorento with transferable warranty.  The test drive sold it to my wife, and I signed the line.  We got an extremely well kept Sorento, with a detailed one owner record review by Teddy.  He answered the questions we had and some that he knew we should ask but not know to.  He was easy to work with.  He was knowledgeable  and we are a family with a great ride.  The experience was great, our turn around time for paperwork was minimal, our satisfaction was at the maximum.
The entire experience was better than I expected.  They treated us very well.  They earned my business.  I will recommend Teddy, when people ask about my wife's new Sorento.

Josh Akins
2/17/2018

name: Ricky Gilliland
text:
Purchased a new 2015 Kia Soul last month. The salesman informed us of an occurring sales event ( we were not aware of it). We had a great experience and was in and out with our new Soul in less than three hours. Every one was friendly and our salesman (Joseph Bibb) went the extra mile to ensure we got a great deal. Thanks to everyone there!
RW Gilliland

resp.text: Ricky, we appreciate the wonderful review and are happy to hear that you were so well taken of! Thank you and congrats on your new Soul!

name: Tamisha Johnson
text: I came to  Riverchase Kia after I visited a Kia dealership in my home town which didn't go well. Marshell greeted me in a friendly manner and we went in and discussed what I wanted. He listened to me and took note of what I wanted. One of the great things I noticed about him was that he was very knowledgeable about Kias. I would definitely recommend him because he was honest, very knowledgeable and made the process of getting a car a smooth transition. In the end, I left with a Kia Optima which is what I wanted. If you go to Riverchase Kia, ask for Marshell you wont be disappointed.

resp.text: Thank you! We appreciate your review and are glad we could make your purchasing process an easy and enjoyable one.

name: Karla McCulley
text: Teddy Fyre at Riverchase Kia was excellent!!My husband and I have been trying for awhile to get rid of an older Cadillac SRX vehicle with no luck. That is until today, when our car salesman, Teddy Frye was able to offer an excellent deal to us. We were FINALLY able to get rid of our vehicle. Teddy was very quick and efficient! He listened to our concerns and needs. He did not try pressuring us into a vehicle as soon as we walked on the lot, which was a breathe of fresh air. We were able to take our time and think about what was best for us.  We are happy to say we got into a new Sorento SUV. Teddy was easy to work with and didn't  hassle us into making the sale. That was truly appreciated!!! He even went the extra mile and gave a referral for Geico insurance that saved us a ton! The finance office was also very quick!! We will definitely use Riverchase Kia again in the future!! We are so appreciative of their awesome business!!

name: Mandy Pierce
text: I came to Riverchase Kia just planning to test drive a Sorento, but from the moment I walked in, it felt more like a place I would want to do business with.  Marderius was polite but persistent in getting me there, calling and emailing me regularly.  Lionel assisted me once I got there, making sure he knew what I was looking for and trying his best to help me find it.  Staci, who had only been there a few days, did a great job of keeping me occupied as Lionel looked for the car I would drive.  When I saw the Sorento I was to test drive, I was immediately pleased, as it was in the color combination I really liked, with even lower miles than I had expected.  Once Rose, the finance manager, got involved in the process, it became clear that I was dealing with someone who not only wanted to sell a car, but was keenly aware of what it would take for me to make that decision.  She displayed excellent customer service and a true willingness to do what it took to find a way for me to get the car I wanted, at the price I wanted.    I would highly recommend considering Riverchase Kia for your next car.

text:
Ask for Lamar Black
I recently have be looking to buy my first car. An for about a year and a half I have been researching the Kia Soul. I first went to the Kia Garderndale,Al but they werent very nice and i felt as if I was in a interview to see if I was good enough for the car. But when I came to Riverchase Kia. Lamar Black meant me  at the door with a smiling face. He knew everything about the car I wanted. He made me feel relaxed when test driving the car. I felt so sure about the car I bought it that day. And still to this day I know that it was the perfect car for me. Thank you Lamar the other dearship made me question my choice but you claried ot for me! Thank you. If you even have a young person looking for a car and dont know much about them. Lamar will put them in a safe and cool car!!!!

name: Nakita
text: My air went out on my car, and as you already know with the heat and rain that was not a good feeling. Even my 3yr old stated mom you I'm sweating lol lol. The air went out Wednesday Oct 6th. I took my car to you guys Thursday Oct 7th.....and when I arrived to the auto tunnel a older lady probably in late 30's or 40, kinda corpulent. I got the expression from her as whatever going on with your car you would have to pay, didn't give other options, just basically it's on me. I understand she have to tell me the fee etc.. but my car is only 2yrs old, and at that moment I didn't want to hear about money, I just wanted professionalism and just let me know it will be OK. I just said make me an appointment for Friday and I will come back. I went back Friday morning and spoke with a pleasant young woman by the name of Season. I think that was her name, b/c it was a unique name. She told me the SAME thing the other lady stated but in a different tone, and made me feel as though she cared. She even let me know by the car being new it may be covered under warranty. I told her my husband can get a gauge to ck it etc.. And she said if we do all that then it's still not working then it's likely a issue that will be fix with no out of pocket expense. I took my car back home again, and my husband did ck it Sunday, and the gauge showed Freon in the car, but stated to take it to the professionals. I then took off work Monday and brought my car back and Season's was there also.. I was happy b/c at this point I was just tired of going into circles. She let me know it may be a wait and was honest about it, and the fee again. I waited 2hrs, but I didn't care b/c I wanted my air fix, and to top it off it was under warranty. Anytime you are dealing with something that is a touchy subject about your car, b/c that is your way of survival and also getting around.... you want people to be knowledge of what's going on, and the situation. Thanks Seasons for your hospitality and patience.

name: Bobby Crabtree
text: If I could go lower than 1 I would, this experience was the most horrible car purchase I've ever had. We went up to riverchase kia at 11am on a saturday. Got immediate help and looked at a specific car. 2015 Kia sorento with 56k miles. Selling for 14k. Lemme tell you, these guys were shady and terrible. Wanted to low ball me on my trade in and jack up my APR with a credit score over 700. Wouldn't honor a coupon that they had online, that someone had already told me I could use in their office. Everytime I came back with a question or counter offer, the salesmen went back and spent about 10 minutes there and would come back with something worse than before. I was looking for integrity on their behalf and found none. Salesmen struggled at explaining most things and the other guys would write their offers down a half sheet of paper with a highlighter and would put an x and a line on the bottom for me to sign to agree to their terms. I asked multiple times for a printed sheet explaining how they came to their offers and was meet with the hand written sentiment everytime. Avoid this place. They are the classic definition of shady dealership. I left and got a better deal with a much better...EVERYTHING!!! Don't let Shamaar help you either. Couldn't tell you anything on his own. Senior Salesmen? I only share for you to avoid the experience I had and go somewhere else 1st. Spent 5 hours there with nothing to show for it.....

name: April Davis
text:
Never again will I go to Riverchase Kia. Today, I went to get my oil changed. I pulled up, got out, and went in the waiting area. I was the only one in there. After about 40 minutes, I see a man drive my car into the bay. I’m thinking: oh finally. I’m getting hungry lol! Another 20 minutes go by. Another man comes into the waiting area asking if that was my Sportage. Why yes. Yes it is. I’m thinking: oh good, it’s done. He says: “what do you need done today?” I said: “ are you serious? I’ve been here over an HOUR and you are the first person I’ve seen.” He says: “oh we were trying to figure out who the car belongs to.” I say (in my voice that is now shrieking): IM THE ONLY ONE HERE. YALL DROVE IT IN THE BAY 20 MINUTES AGO! I’M THE ONLY ONE THAT’S BEEN HERE!
I got in my car and left. I was so stinking mad. On my way home, I decided to call them and speak with a manager. The first girl, Kaitlin, left me on hold for 10 minutes. I called Back. Nicolette left me on hold for 5 minutes. They have the worst customer experience I have ever experienced. Never. Again.

resp.text: Congratulations on your first brand new Kia, April! It is so exciting that you found the perfect car and that Mr. Henry took such amazing care of you throughout your car buying experience. We really enjoyed working with you and appreciate your business. Please don't hesitate to come visit us for any of your future car needs. Safe travels in your new Sportage!

name: Elizabeth Knobloch
text: My Husband and I went in looking to trade in my vehicle which I was upside down in payments with and his old paid for vehicle for 2 brand New 2017 Kia's. We did not expect to be able to do it but went anyways to see our options and what we needed to do. Teddy was clear and upfront that he made no promises but would do absolutely everything in his power to get us driving away in new vehicles. HE MADE IT HAPPEN! He worked with us, the finance people, and the banks to get me out of my bad situation and get us in our new vehicles in the price range we felt comfortable with in less than 4 hours. We were also helped out by Joey Bibb. He did an awesome job with helping with test drives, getting our new cars cleaned and gassed up, giving feedback on gas mileage, and making sire we had a great experience.  Thank you so much Teddy and Joey! We will be sending everyone we can on yalls direction!

name: Amanda Bunt
text: Riverchase kia and their sales associate Teddy Frye were awesome. Mr. Frye was very straightforward and honest with us not your typical car salesman to say the least. I would reccommend riverchase kia to anyone. Go see them and ask for Teddy Frye.

resp.text: We think you're awesome, Amanda! Thanks for sharing about your wonderful experience here at Riverchase Kia and we hope you'll be back to work with Teddy and the rest of our team again!

name: Ann Sherwood
text: The top 1-2 things that I hate to do is go car shopping. My hell started on Sat 10/15/2016 where I ended up at Benton of Nissan knowing exactly which car I wanted to buy which was the versa 2016 advertised for $9,995 - long story short, the agent told me there would be another cost of $1500 added to the car which I thought was misleading/advertising, then the sales agent presented me with a smilar versa 2016 for $15,000 which I strongly felt was a bait n switch car, and was strongly urged to hurry and sign for the car, so after 4 hours, and feeling super pressured to buy this car, my gut just said walk away, and i listened to my gut; however, I still needed a car; on my way out again on 10/17/2016 I stopped off at ford, where I was shown the 2016 Fiesta with sunroof, which was fully loaded for $16,300 compared to the versa 2016 that they were trying to sell for $15,000. I got no sales pressure from ford, but I felt I needed to go to another dealer, since I already owned a car from Riverchase Kia, I then went back over there to see what they had; I ended up buying the 2014 Kia Rio with 34kmiles; Runs great, and the look of the car is very modern and sleek, and feel within my budget range. sales agent Teddy Fryer was cool as hell, and while they were working on the paperwork, we even took a second test drive just to make sure everything was good, and it was. teddy, I gave benton their just review, look it up when you have time. thanks

resp.text: This is fantastic to hear, Ann! Teddy is an amazing member of our team and we know he will be thrilled to hear how much you appreciate him over the other salesmen you worked with at other dealerships. Here at Riverchase Kia, we value our customers and want their car buying experience to be comfortable and easy so they can make the best decision without the pressure, just like your experience. Thank you for choosing us and we are here whenever you have another car need. Enjoy your new Kia Rio!

name: Gregory Chiadika
text: Attempted to buy a new Kia from Riverchase Kiai.  They advertised on tv that their vehicles were up to 10,000 dollars off.  I didn't believe it.  I went to the website and it appeared to confirm the special.  It even gave an example of a Kia Optima that started off a 26,900 would be discounted to $16,900.  I still didn't believe it so I decided it would be better to email the dealership.  I told them that I was only interested in vehicles that qualified for the $10,000 off. The dealership representative , Marderius Appleberry, emailed me every car except the ones that qualified.  I reiterated that I wanted to buy a vehicle that qualified for the $10,000 off.  He again showed me every car under the sun except the ones that qualified for the special.  Eventually, he began asking me to come in to see the car.  I told him that I didn't see the point if you can't even confirm they would actually sell a vehicle for the $10,000 as advertised.  Riverchase Kia ought to be ashamed of themselves.

resp.text: Mr. Chiadika, we would like to discuss this matter in more detail. It is our goal that every customer receive superior customer service, so if we could come to a resolution that is satisfactory to you, that's what we would like to do. Please call us at 407-792-3972. Thank you.

text: Would give 5 because when I got the car in 2019 they were super helpful and everyone was nice and worked with you. I put down more than what was asked for my car and it's a nice car. The only thing is that when you're in an industry to provide customer service I feel as though that should apply to all aspects of your company if that is what you're offering. Due to covid I have had to take off work to keep my daughter whose virtually schooled and my job has had to shut down several times due to an outbreak. They aren't really helpful with this. Still having to pay insurance and you can let it fall or your car will be repoed and you if you fall a week behind on your payments your car will be repoed. In total i pay $613.00 a month for car and insurance payments. I can barely make rent and keep groceries and pay utilities with no government assistance. All have helped during covid or been lenient except for Holmes Motors. I feel they should be a little more understanding due to the circumstances. They haven't been helpful AT ALL!!!

text: If I could give a zero rating I would!! What I have to say is not about this particular location but with a guy name Patrick who works for this company. This man was downright rude towards me when an issue happen that THEY WERE AT FAULT FOR!!! This man talked down to me from the start of the conversation to the end. Not once did he apologize for the inconvenience that was put on me for their mistake. Instead he made sure to threaten me about my car. I have never had customer service given to me in the rude manner that he gave me. When I tried to explain the situation, he talked over me and down to me like I was the size of an ant. The situation was fixed but I had to be talked to like I was nothing before I got there. A lot of us have been through hell and back with everything that is going on right now and the last thing anyone needs is to be talked to in the manner that he did. Horrible man and dont see why he is in that field!!! Hopefully he will get his soon!!

text: My transmission went out Sunday & with my car being under the 2 yr warranty, Holmes took care of everything, with only me paying $100 for a Repair fee. It only took 4 days, they are always nice & welcoming to their customers. I would recommend this place to anyone looking to lease a car.

name: Christina Mcgirt
text: I gave them 4 stars because you can't be over 7 days late on your vehicle under any circumstances or they will disable your vehicle and reposses it. Circumstances do happen in life and i feel like they should be more understanding to that to keep a customer. Other than that everything is good. I came in with the amount they wanted down for my vehicle and drove off the lot withTHAT vehicle. No games or bs. Be ready to pay though.

name: Brandi Johnson
text: They are absolutely fantastic people to work with.  I recommend them to anyone!!!!!

name: Josh Lisenby
text:
Believe me when I say I have no problem complaining when the customer service isn’t up to par. I have been in customer service as a manager for several years. I have always been glad to get negative reviews because that’s how we grew and improved. Although positive reviews are far and few between. I like to write positive reviews when they are due. Holmes Motors deserves a good review. I bought a 2012 Ford Expedition on 11/19/2019. Beautiful vehicle, we got great customer service, the cleanliness was also top notch. On 11/25/2019, I was driving home from work and lost power while driving down the road. The engine light started flashing and totally shut down. I called Kym (sales Rep) immediately the next morning. I figured I would have to get it TOWED to Birmingham (108 miles) plus pay the $100 deductible. This dealership towed it for FREE, charged no deductible, and got us a nicer/newer vehicle the same day. All against what my contract said. This company turned what could’ve been a nightmare into a blessing. They definitely made it right and I really appreciate it. The contract clearly states buyer is responsible to get it to the dealership and pay $100 for any repairs in the first year. I am a dad to five kids and this made me a life time customer.

AMAZING CUSTOMER SERVICE. I REALLY APPRECIATE EVERYTHING FROM THE BOTTOM OF MY HEART.

name: Chandra Wilson
text: Mr. Black was very personable, well informed and patient. The main area was well kept and maintained. The entire process was throughly explained. Overall it was a great customer experience and I’m enjoying my vehicle.

text: I recently visited Premier Chevrolet with my daughter. We were immediately greeted by Henry Corley, who went above and beyond to be sure we found the perfect vehicle for my daughter. name: Big Daddy Kane
text: I purchased a beautiful Camaro from Grant recently. The communication and transaction was perfectly smooth. It was the easiest car purchase I have ever made and no hassle what so ever. We had a conversation about the car I wanted. He went and got the car ready to go immediately and opened up his schedule for me to come by any time. I sent over all the financials before visiting the dealership. When I arrived the vehicle was waiting on my out front ready to test drive. We had a great conversation while I was test driving the car. I approved of the car and we quickly moved into the paper work. Their finance team was on the ball and had everything ready for me to sign and discuss. I was in and out of the dealership in an hour and a half. They have a great team there that understands what customer obsession is all about. Thank you for the great purchase and I am sure I will be referring customers in the future.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience here at Premiere Chevrolet. Your feedback and kind words mean a lot to us. We pride ourselves in providing  excellent customer service. Thank you again and we look forward to seeing your for any of your automotive needs!

We are so thankful that you chose us to handle Blue Thunder ( vehicle) repairs and look forward to being your one stop automotive shop. We consider you a part of the Premiere Family now!

name: Jim Clark
text:
Recently, my daughter was traveling from Tuscaloosa to the Birmingham airport and had some car trouble.  She managed to make it to Premiere Chevrolet in Bessemer.  They not only scheduled the car for repairs, but got her to the airport in time to make her flight home for Christmas.  Upon returning to Birmingham, they picked her up at the airport to take her back to her repaired vehicle.  She is now safely back in Tuscaloosa to finish her Senior year.  So appreciative of their efforts, and the fact that we were still able to enjoy Christmas with her.

They also did a fantastic job of explaining and fixing the problem with her car.  I just can’t imagine receiving this kind of service anywhere else.  Great service, with above and beyond southern hospitality.  You can’t go wrong with this dealership.

name: Tameka Boyd
